com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor

Class OracleAdaptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.Adaptor
      • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.JDBCAdaptor
        • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.OracleAdaptor

  • public class OracleAdaptor
extends JDBCAdaptor
    JDBCAdaptor class for execution of Oracle SQL queries. This is a subclass of JDBCAdaptor but only overrides the constructors. JDBCAdaptor, thought abstract, was initially created as an Oracle adaptor, and by and large, contains generic code.
    Author:
    David Varon

    • Method Detail

      • buildSelect

        public StringBuffer buildSelect(String core,
                       String sortKey,
                       String sortOrder,
                       int firstRow,
                       int pageSize,
                       org.json.JSONObject filters)
                         throws YADAAdaptorException
        Create a YADA SELECT statement from core wrapping it in two subqueries to account for pagination, sorting, and filtering with a where clause.
        Overrides:
        buildSelect in class JDBCAdaptor
        Parameters:
        core - the code to wrap
        sortKey - the column on which to sort
        sortOrder - the sort order 'asc' or 'desc'
        firstRow - the lower limiter of the result set
        pageSize - the number of rows to return
        filters - a JSON object containing the WHERE criteria
        Returns:
        StringBuffer containing newly wrapped core sql, with pagination, filtering, and sorting, as desired
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - when the query filters can't be converted into a WHERE clause

      • buildSelectCount

        public StringBuffer buildSelectCount(String core,
                            org.json.JSONObject filters)
                              throws YADAAdaptorException
        Returns a StringBuffer with core sql + filters, wrapped in an outer sql COUNT(*) query. This is typically used in pagination scenarios to return the total number of records returnable by a query when only a subset are requested by the application.
        Overrides:
        buildSelectCount in class JDBCAdaptor
        Parameters:
        core - the SQL to wrap in an outer count(*) query
        filters - a JSON object containing the WHERE criteria
        Returns:
        StringBuffer of wrapped core sql including filters
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - when the query filters can't be converted into a WHERE clause

      • setTimestampParameter

        protected void setTimestampParameter(PreparedStatement pstmt,
                         int index,
                         char type,
                         String val)
                              throws SQLException
        Enables checking for JDBCAdaptor.ORACLE_TIMESTAMP_FMT if val does not conform to JDBCAdaptor.STANDARD_TIMESTAMP_FMT
        Overrides:
        setTimestampParameter in class JDBCAdaptor
        Parameters:
        pstmt - the statement in which to set the parameter values
        index - the current parameter
        type - the data type of the parameter (retained here for logging)
        val - the value to set
        Throws:
        SQLException - when a parameter cannot be set, for instance if the data type is wrong or unsupported
        Since:
        0.5.1.1
